definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

sentences.chinese: 事故发生后，一个后轮发生了爆胎。

sentences.english: I will never forget the day I had a flat tire.
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会忘记我那次爆胎的情景。

sentences.english: Large proportion of accidents are caused by the burst in our country.
sentences.chinese: 在我国因为轮胎爆胎而导致事故发生的占很大比例。

sentences.english: If you get a flat tire, you have to turn on your flashing lights.
sentences.chinese: 当你发生爆胎时，你必须打开紧示灯。

sentences.english: “And we wouldn’t have seen it if the tire hadn’t blown, ” says Doris.
sentences.chinese: “要是不爆胎，我们就看不见这个了，”多丽丝说。

sentences.english: There's a puncture, and Nick from the support van got to work.
sentences.chinese: 在那里遭遇了爆胎，保障车上的尼克有活干了。

sentences.english: A tire pressure monitoring and automatic deceleration system for tire blow-out is developed.
sentences.chinese: 开发出一种汽车轮胎气压监测与爆胎自动减速系统。

definition: to tailgate/to hit the car in front as a result of tailgating
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
to scrape one's car against sth/to sideswipe
oil spill/oil leak/(fig.) boo! (opposite of 加油[jia1 you2])
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
